categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several improvements and fixes have been made to the eliza repository:

- The OpenAI plugin was extended to support custom embedding endpoints (PR #4421)
- Authentication middleware was added along with an API key dialog for unauthenticated users (PR #4420)
- The Reply feature was updated to use a small model for better performance (PR #4416)
- Forced bootstrap plugin addition was removed (PR #4417)
- Unnecessary express object creation was eliminated to improve efficiency (PR #4414)
- Plugin storage for S3 was removed as part of a cleanup effort (PR #4402)

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository recently:

1. MySQL Integration: Two related PRs (#4412 and #4413) by 0xbbjoker focus on adding MySQL support to the system. PR #4412 introduces a MySQL adapter feature, while PR #4413 adds a MySQL plugin.

2. Code Quality: PR #4410 by lalalune addresses linting issues, which helps maintain code quality and consistency.

3. Authentication Improvements: PR #4420 by wtfsayo adds authentication middleware and implements an API key dialog that appears when a user is unauthenticated.

4. CLI Enhancement: PR #4424 by yungalgo refactors and enhances the elizaOS publish CLI command, as indicated by the PR title referencing 'Eli2 268'.

From May 1-2, 2025, the elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity with 13 new pull requests, of which 6 were merged. The repository also received 1 new issue during this period. The project maintained an active community with 12 contributors participating during these two days.

categories.title: Error: No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_EMBEDDING with OpenAI

content.text: GitHub issue #4418 reports a problem where users are encountering an error message stating "No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_EMBEDDING" when attempting to use OpenAI embeddings. This appears to be a functionality issue in the elizaOS/eliza project related to text embedding capabilities with OpenAI integration.

The provided source only mentions 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' without providing any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary of the top contributors to the elizaOS/eliza project.
